author: Avery Moore
title: 8 Enormous Thrift Stores In Kansas That Are Absolutely Worth The Road Trip
text:
Searching for gigantic thrift stores in Kansas that justify a special journey?
These 8 enormous secondhand shops offer treasure-filled adventures and incredible bargains worth every mile of your drive!
1. Goodwill (Topeka)
Ever walked into a place so big you wished you’d brought breadcrumbs to find your way back out?
Welcome to Goodwill in Topeka!
This place is so huge you might need to pack a lunch just to make it through all the departments.
The clothing section stretches for what feels like miles with everything organized by size, type, and color.
It’s like walking through a rainbow made of t-shirts and jeans.
The furniture area could furnish an entire apartment building with sofas, tables, and chairs for days.
Their book section is a bibliophile’s dream with shelves upon shelves of everything from bestsellers to obscure titles you forgot existed.
The housewares department is where kitchen dreams come true with gadgets you never knew you needed.
Who knew you wanted a waffle maker shaped like the state of Kansas until you saw it?
The electronics section requires patience but rewards the persistent with amazing finds.
Vintage record players, working blenders, and occasionally even computers line these shelves.
The toy area looks like Santa’s workshop after a massive clearance sale.
Board games, stuffed animals, and plastic toys of every description await new homes.
Color-coded tags tell you which items are on special discount that week.
Pro tip: Mondays are when they put out weekend donations, making it prime hunting time!
Where: 5515 SW 21st St, Topeka, KS 66604
2. Savers (Overland Park)
Savers in Overland Park isn’t just big – it’s practically its own zip code!
This mammoth thrift store offers so much merchandise you might need to schedule multiple visits.
The clothing department seems to go on forever with racks organized by size, gender, and type.
Their selection ranges from everyday basics to outfits so fancy you wonder where the original owner possibly wore them.
The shoe section is a footwear fantasy with everything from practical work boots to sparkly heels that have barely touched pavement.
You could literally try on shoes for hours here!
The housewares area is where kitchen dreams are born with gadgets, dishes, and small appliances galore.
Need a bread maker, popcorn machine, and three different types of blenders?
They’ve got you covered.
The furniture section showcases everything from practical dining sets to statement pieces that make you stop and stare.
I’ve spotted mid-century modern pieces that would cost a fortune in antique shops!
Their book corner is impressively organized by genre, making it easy to find your next beach read or reference book.
The toy section is a nostalgic wonderland where you’ll find yourself saying, “I had that as a kid!” at least a dozen times.
The seasonal section transforms throughout the year, becoming a Halloween headquarters or Christmas wonderland depending on the month.
New merchandise hits the floor daily, so no two visits are ever the same.
It’s like a treasure hunt where X marks a different spot every time!
Where: 5441 W 95th St, Overland Park, KS 66207
3. The Salvation Army Family Store & Donation Center (Manhattan)
The Salvation Army in Manhattan is housed in a charming brick building that’s bursting with bargains!
This downtown treasure trove has that classic thrift store aroma – a mixture of vintage clothing, old books, and endless possibilities.
The clothing section dominates the main floor with racks neatly organized by type and size.
Their men’s suit selection would make a corporate executive jealous.
The women’s dress area looks like it raided closets from every decade since the Eisenhower administration.
The furniture department upstairs features everything from practical pieces to items that make you wonder, “What were they thinking?”
The book corner might be small, but it’s mighty with titles ranging from college textbooks to paperback romances with covers that tell quite a story themselves.
Their collection of knickknacks and decorative items is where the real entertainment begins.
It’s like a museum of “Things People Once Thought Would Look Good in Their Living Room.”
The vintage kitchen section makes you nostalgic for grandma’s cooking with Pyrex dishes and utensils they simply don’t make anymore.
The toy area is a blast from the past with board games, action figures, and stuffed animals looking for new homes.
The best part?
Your purchases help fund their community programs, so you can shop guilt-free!
The volunteers are friendly and always ready with a smile or helpful suggestion.
Where: 310 Poyntz Ave, Manhattan, KS 66502
4. Adelante Thrift (Kansas City)
Adelante Thrift in Kansas City is a treasure hunter’s paradise that locals wish tourists didn’t know about!
This spacious store serves the diverse Kansas City community with bilingual signage and merchandise that reflects many cultures.
The clothing section is impressively organized with everything from work clothes to fancy outfits for special occasions.

Their children’s department could dress an entire elementary school with plenty of options left over.
The housewares area is where kitchen dreams come true with gadgets and tools from every culinary tradition.
Need a tortilla press, rice cooker, or specialized coffee maker?
They’ve probably got three.
The furniture section features solid wood pieces that would cost a small fortune if purchased new.
I’ve spotted dining sets that look like they came straight from a high-end catalog!
Their selection of home decor ranges from tastefully subtle to wonderfully over-the-top.
The wall art section alone could keep you browsing until closing time.
The book corner offers titles in multiple languages, reflecting the neighborhood’s diverse population.
Their seasonal section transforms throughout the year, from summer picnic supplies to holiday decorations that make you feel festive.
The store has a wonderful community atmosphere with regulars who greet each other like old friends.
The staff works tirelessly to keep everything clean and organized, making your treasure hunt much more enjoyable.
Prices are some of the most reasonable in the Kansas City area!
Where: 3720 State Ave, Kansas City, KS 66102
5. TurnStyles Thrift (Overland Park)
TurnStyles in Overland Park is thrift shopping for people who think they’re too fancy for thrift shopping!
This massive store is so clean and well-organized that first-time visitors often ask if they’re actually in a department store.
The clothing sections are arranged with precision, with men’s, women’s, and children’s areas clearly marked and sorted by size.
Their dress section looks like it came straight from a boutique, not someone’s donation pile.
The shoe department is impressive with footwear for every occasion from gardening to gala events.
The furniture area showcases pieces that look barely used, from comfortable sofas to dining sets that could grace a magazine cover.
The housewares section is a kitchen enthusiast’s dream with gadgets, dishes, and small appliances at a fraction of retail prices.
Their book corner is meticulously organized by genre, making it easy to find your next great read.
The toy section is a nostalgic journey through childhood with games, puzzles, and toys from every era.
The jewelry counter features everything from fun costume pieces to items that make you wonder if they’re actually valuable.
The store supports Catholic Charities, so your shopping spree actually helps people in need!
Staff members are friendly and seem genuinely happy to be working there.
The dressing rooms are clean and spacious – a luxury not always found in thrift store world!
Where: 11310 W 135th St, Overland Park, KS 66213
6. Blessings Abound (Overland Park)
Blessings Abound truly lives up to its name with a store absolutely overflowing with treasures!
This volunteer-run thrift shop takes up what used to be a grocery store, giving you aisles upon aisles to explore.
The clothing section seems endless with racks organized by size, type, and sometimes even color.
Their selection of professional attire is perfect for anyone needing to dress for success on a budget.
The children’s clothing area could outfit an entire school with adorable options at amazing prices.
The furniture section features everything from practical pieces to unique finds that make you stop in your tracks.
I once spotted a hand-carved rocking chair that belonged in a museum, not a thrift store!
The housewares department is a kitchen lover’s paradise with gadgets, dishes, and small appliances that look barely used.
Their book section is impressively organized, making it easy to find something new to read.
The toy area is a wonderland of gently used treasures that will make any child (or child-at-heart) jump for joy.
The holiday section transforms throughout the year, becoming a patriotic showcase or winter wonderland depending on the season.
The store supports local charities, so your bargain hunting actually helps your community!
Volunteers are friendly and clearly passionate about their mission.
The store is exceptionally clean for a thrift shop, making the treasure hunting experience much more pleasant.
Where: 10325 Metcalf Ave, Overland Park, KS 66212
7. My Best Friend’s Closet (Shawnee)
My Best Friend’s Closet in Shawnee feels exactly like raiding your stylish friend’s wardrobe – if your friend had impossibly good taste and endless closet space!
This boutique-style thrift shop specializes in women’s clothing and accessories with a more curated selection than your average secondhand store.
The clothing is organized beautifully by size and type, making it easy to find exactly what you’re looking for.
Their dress section looks like it came straight from a department store, not someone’s donation pile.
The quality control here is impressive – you won’t find stained or damaged items on these racks!
The accessories section features scarves, jewelry, and handbags that look barely used.
I’ve spotted designer purses that would cost hundreds new going for less than the price of a casual dinner out!
The shoe department is a fashion lover’s dream with everything from practical flats to statement heels.
Unlike many thrift stores, they limit their inventory to truly desirable items.
This means less digging through junk and more finding actual treasures!
The store has a boutique feel with attractive displays and organized racks.
Staff members are friendly and fashion-savvy, offering suggestions if you’re looking for something specific.
The dressing rooms are clean and spacious with good lighting – a luxury in thrift store world!
Prices are higher than some thrift stores but still far below retail for the quality you’re getting.
Where: 12152 Shawnee Mission Pkwy, Shawnee, KS 66216
8. Ellis Community Thrift Shop (Ellis)
The Ellis Community Thrift Shop proves that small towns can hide big surprises!
This charming store might not look enormous from the outside, but step inside and you’ll discover it’s packed to the rafters with treasures.
The clothing section offers everything from everyday basics to special occasion outfits at prices that will make your wallet do a happy dance.
Their selection reflects the practical nature of small-town Kansas with plenty of work clothes and comfortable basics.
The housewares department is a kitchen lover’s dream with vintage Pyrex, practical pots and pans, and quirky gadgets from yesteryear.
I once spotted a bread maker that looked like it had never even been taken out of the box!
The furniture area showcases solid wood pieces that were built to last generations.
You’ll find dining sets, bedroom furniture, and comfortable seating options at a fraction of new prices.
The book corner is small but mighty with plenty of paperbacks perfect for summer reading.
Their collection of knickknacks and decorative items tells the story of changing home decor trends through the decades.
The toy section is a nostalgic trip through childhood with board games, stuffed animals, and toys from every era.
The store has that wonderful small-town feel where the volunteers might remember what you were looking for last time.
Prices are incredibly reasonable, reflecting the practical nature of the community.
The store supports local charities, so your bargain hunting actually helps your neighbors!
Where: 1013 Washington St, Ellis, KS 67637
Thrift shopping in Kansas isn’t just about finding bargains – it’s about the adventure of discovery!
These eight enormous stores offer endless possibilities for uncovering treasures while supporting worthy causes across the Sunflower State.
Happy hunting, and may the thrift gods smile upon your journey!
